meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I preshowed the magic tricks to my friend.
meanings.sent2: She preshowed the new dance routine to the audience before the show.
meanings.sent3: The cat preshowed its hunting skills by chasing a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The early morning sunlight preshowed the start of a beautiful day.
meanings.sent5: The chef preshowed the final dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: preshowed: showed or displayed before an event or performance
meanings.sent1: The teacher preshowed the science experiment to the students.
meanings.sent2: They preshowed the movie trailers before the main feature.
meanings.sent3: The clown preshowed his juggling skills by tossing colorful balls in the air.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds preshowed the impending rain with dark, heavy formations.
meanings.sent5: The artist preshowed her masterpiece with a grand unveiling ceremony.
